newsitem.title: USA: CMS Energy sees Palisades plant running upto 2007.
newsitem.headline: CMS Energy sees Palisades plant running upto 2007.

text.p: CMS Energy Corp plans to keep its Palisades nuclear plant in Michigan running through the end of its license in 2007, company chairman and CEO William McCormick said Wednesday.

The company last week announced it would close its other nuclear plant, Big Rock, ahead of the end of its license, which expires in 2000, because it did not make sense to pour money into the 67 megawatt unit so close to its expiration.
Palisades has a maximum capacity of 762 megawatts.
"In the case of Palisades, we're hoping and expecting to continue to operate that plant through its license life," McCormick said at a press briefing.
"The plant runs well, doing exceptionally well the last few years. We have no reason to believe that it won't continue to operate for the foreseeable future," he said.
